1.content: Now then, since the number of games/media and characters involved with Touhou are absolutely staggering, I've decided it's much easier to let this be a pick your own storyline, kind of deal. It allows for much more freedom in expansion choice and which characters you wish to use. I only ask that you keep the storyline listings going to give others a chance to try their luck.
1.title: Into the Eastern Wonderlands...

11.content:
The magical library of Viole'.

An immense and labyrinthine library that sat below in the bowels of the Scarlet Devil Mansion. As far as the eye can see lay shelves upon shelves of any magical tome, grimoire and guidebook there could ever exist. For centuries, this vast collection of pages and covers was amassed by a single person, an extremely compulsive reader and a good friend to the owner of the mansion her mammoth library lay beneath; Patchouli Knowledge, otherwise known as the Unmoving Great Library, a fitting name for a witch that found no interest to leave her vast collection for over one hundred years on end.

Patchouli herself was a rather introverted individual, having no interest in the world outside of her library and putting all of her efforts in studying magic and experimenting with various aspects of the mystical and alchemic arts. This disinteresting in going out, also seemed to be due to the witch's less than stellar physical constitution, but it was something she could deal with considering her profession and usual hobbies. Despite her ill nature, Patchouli's figure was rather zaftig and healthy, the lack of manual labor and work on her part giving rise to a gradual layer of fat accumulating on her already curvy physique. The witch's pajama like attire swelled out in various areas of thickness, her hefty bosom resting atop a slightly convexed paunch that lightly swelled the middle of Patchouli's stripped dress. Below lay the exapnse of her wide and thickened hips and equally bounteous bottom that filled the frilly nightwear with it's jiggling mass.

"Okay, everything seems to be in order..."

The witch's hushed voice muttered out, her sleepy eyes gazing into the pages of a thickened grimoire before craning upward to stare at her current construction; an incricate magic circle adorned with runes and ancient glyphs of an esoteric origin. However, while these sigils could mean nothing to the common mind, Patchouli knew exactly what these letters meant to her newly built gateway of sorcery; they were designed to call forth an entity from another plane, the alternate and demonic world of Makai. Indeed, Patchouli was going to summon a demon.

Even though Patchouli had one demonic familiar helping her in the library, it was already clear that another would be required as a means of both giving the aforementioned help and perhaps specializing in combat to deter any threats and intruders who step foot in this library unannounced. Her current familiar, Koakuma, was effectual and actually helped bridge a social gap that Patchouli herself never would have crossed. However, when it came to handling more than one task and combat, her abilities seemed to falter. It was through this observation that Patchouli came to the conclusion that another familiar was needed to help make things a little more effecient in the library.

With another silent check around to see if anything was out of order, the pruplenette began the summoning ritual, a magical aura manifesting across her plump form as the tome she held began to levitate from her fingertips. Patchouli's lips muttered of an unknowable demonic tongue, her streaming chant coaxing the magical circle to glow and mingle with her swirling energies. Soon enough, the once calm exchange of magic began to intensify by the second, the magic circle's brightened aura empowering itself with Patchouli's magic as it began to establish a connection with the demon she wished to summon from Makai.

When the mystical energies reached their absolute peak, Patchouli spread her arms wide and ushered in the new addition to her library and her new familiar; "AND WITH MY WORDS, I COMMEND THEE, TO BRING FORTH A CHILD OF SHINKI!"

The magic circle agreed to her request, the center of it's form erupting with a pillar of light as mauve flames ignited on the numerous corners of the runic summoning circle. A deep rumble began to thunder from the core of the magic circle before a bolt of mystical lightning struck down in it's center, a bright and luminous nova exploding from the circle as the familiar made it's way to the library's native coil.

Patchouli covered her eyes as the brightened flare began to slowly lose it's blinding splendor, the witch blinking several times as she was slowly allowed the ability to gaze into the calming circle. Slowly, as the light dispersed, Patchouli was able to the new familiar's form, her sights managing to see...
11.title: Demonic Bibliophilia

choices: She began reading, the imp-shota snuggling her in his sleep.
She felt a pair of eyes and turned to see him awake.
112.content:
Patchouli heard a yawn, a rather youthful one at that come from the epicenter. The purplenette walked closer towards the circle as her eyes readjusted and looked down.

Laying on the ground, curled up in sleep was a ver young teenage boy, although she could easily make out the pointed ears, tiny bat wings on his shoulder blades, and a sleek blue tail with a spade at the end of it. He was dressed in-

"Nothing..." She muttered as she looked down at the naked demon boy. He had a peaceful look on his face as he continued to sleep soundly without a care in the world. His white hair long and stopping to his shoulders. He also had intriuging red tatoos on his body as well, and Patchouli turned around to head towards her chambers. She needed to cover his boy up and maybe find him some clothes.

After the tiring walk to her bedroom and returning with a blanket, she wrapped the quilt over the imp and carried him bridal-style to a nearby couch and set him down gently. He seemed to take in the blanket more, snuggling deeper and a smile deepening across his face.

"So," Muttered Patchouli. "This is my familiar huh?" That said, the purplenette grabbed a book on a nearby table and sat her large rear on the couch, lounging back to give it's content's a look over and-
112.title: A youthful Imp

1122.content:
After only a few minutes of reading into her book, Patchouli noticed that the young imp was staring at her, wide awake and wide eyed. He still had the blanket wrapped around him, and was seemingly pleading at Patchouli.

Shutting her book, Patchouli questioned "Oh, you're up. Something bothering you?"

The white haired boy nodded rapidly, his motions almost making it look like his head would snap off. Walking away from Patchouli and towards one of her many bookcases, he then pointed silently next to it. Setting her book down, Patchouli trudged along the floor, making her way to the bookcase. When she got there, Patchouli was met with an unusual sight.

Following the finger of her new familiar, she saw several books from the cases floating in the air, hovering for a short while before descending into a bag on the floor. The bag looked pretty full, with several books already inside. Patchouli soon felt a tug on her gown, only to see the imp holding up a book. Glancing at the book's title, it read "The Invisible Man."

"Huh? Why are you showing me thi-" Patchouli stopped herself in mid sentence, understanding why the Imp showed her the book. Hovering quickly towards the closest bathroom, she came back with a fresh cup of water. With it, she walked over to the bag of books and the steady stream of literature entering the bag. As Patchouli approached, she noticed the floating book freeze into place, and the bag on the floor begin to move, as if being tugged away.

"Just as he thought, this isn't magic, it's just someone using an invisibility spell or potion." Patchouli thought as she chased the supposed invisible figure. "I won't be surprised if it's who I think it is....."

With the cup of water in hand, she threw the liquid in front of her, supposedly at the invisible person. Much to her and the Imp's pleasure, who was currently waving his hands around in joy, the liquid hit something and formed the shape of a person. As the water overrided the effects of the invisibility, a familiar figure began to materialise in front of Patchouli and the Imp. This figure was no other than...
1122.title: She felt a pair of eyes and turned to see him a...

choices: Marisa is still caught on the chair
11221.content:
Patchouli's face grew weary as she instantly recognised the black and white clothing she had grown to loath. In the very same cocky smile she always had on her face, Marisa Kirisame appeared before Patchouli and the Imp. Quickly shoving her current book into the bag of others, she gave a wave.

"Oh, hey Patchouli! I know what you're thinking, "Really Marisa? You think some simple invisibility potion is going to outsmart me?" Let me tell you, I had my doubts from the beginning, so don't think I'm losing my touch or nothing." Marisa scratched the back of her head in an embarrassed way.

Tilting her head past Patchouli, Marisa noticed the young imp boy behind her, smiling at the sight of her. "Ooooo, I haven't seen him before! Is he a new familiar? A boyfriend? The second brother's son on your mother's side?"

Firing a barrage of Danamku at Marisa the second she stopped talking, Patchouli took to the air and began her assault, rage seething behind her eyes. Whistling with her fingers, Marisa's broom weaved through the library and flew over to her, giving her the time to hop onto it. With Marisa trying to make a swift escape and Patchouli wanting to shoot her down, it was a quite a spectacle for the Imp to see.

As Patchouli started to slow down, cough violently as she flew, Marisa turned around on her broom and slowed down. "What? Tired already? Come on Patchy get your act together! Seriously, go see Eirin or someone, you're in awful shape."

No longer wanting to see anymore of Marisa's attitude, the boy's eye glowed bright red. Raising his hands, a red aura radiated from them. As they did, Marisa soon felt herself and her broom both come to a stop. Looking around, she noticed that she and the broom were both trapped in a red aura, just like the one the boy was using. Suddenly, Marisa was pulled down to the ground, trapped inside the red glow, until she was brought onto a spare chair, and soon fitted with a red aura styled binding spell.

Slowly levitating back to ground, Patchouli covered her mouth to cough and soon met up with the Imp. "That was remarkable! Thank you ever so much." Patchouli then followed the boy towards the chair where Marisa was held.
11221.title: Marisa

112211.content:
Near Patchouli's study, Marisa struggled against the binding spell that held her onto the chair, her legs wriggling around in an attempt to free herself. Noticing that Patchouli was approaching, she gave a smile.

"Heh, looks like that new familiar of yours is a pretty talented kid. He caught me on his first try, something you've never been able to do!" Marisa laughed, Patchouli feeling hurt by her words. "Maybe you should let him take over the library? He'd do a far better job than you!"

With a snap of Patchouli's fingers, Marisa's mouth disappeared from her face, leaving the magician to muffle what other jibes she had to say. Making her way back to the Imp, she knelt over and whispered to him "She is right, this is the first time she's even been caught." Patchouli stroked her chin. "Come to think of it, I haven't ever thought of something to do with her. I'll need to get something arranged to teach her a lesson, not to mention keep her out of my hair for a while. Maybe you could think of something?"

Taking in Patchouli's words, the Imp scratched his head. An audible "Hmm" could be heard, which was soon followed by him dashing into one of the many sections of the library. It wasn't long before he returned with a book, bounding over to Patchouli and passing her the book.

Examining the cover, Patchouli saw that the book was called "Hansel and Gretel". "This familiar seems to like Outside World stories." She pondered, opening the book.

Stories from the Outside weren't Patchouli's personal preference for books. They very rarely talked about magic, usually having some kind of fictional magic that is merely for entertainment purposes. While modern technology and ideas could be learnt from Outside literature, it was mostly things that would be very hard for Patchouli to replicate, the only endeavour she ever took involving Outside World technology being the rocket that was made to traverse to the Moon. Even then, it took a lot of teamwork and some help from the Lunarians to even get going. Simply put, Patchouli did not read Outside World books to much.

Flicking through the pages of the book the Imp had given her, she soon came to a conclusion on her familiar's idea.
112211.title: Marisa is still caught on the chair

choices: Sakuya hears and likes the plan.
Sakuya hears and dislikes the plan.
1122111.content:
As Patchouli flicked through the pages of the book her Imp had brought to her attention, a smile slowly crept onto her face. She took note of the two fictional children as they munched their way through a gingerbread house and continued to snack on much to the also fictional witches delight. Patchouli's mind flared with ideas and she shut the book just before the Witch revealed her plans in the story. The purple clothed magician had read enough to know what she thought of this idea.

Patchouli grabbed the Imp and gave him a peck on his cheek, Patchouli surprised herself at her impulsive action. "You are a genius, this plan is great!" She whispered to him. "If we can fatten up Marisa to immobility there's no way she'll bother us ever again!" Making her way over to the exit of her library, Patchouli gave a quick wave to the Imp before she took her leave.

Floating up the stairs and into the Scarlet Devil Mansion's hallways, Patchouli began her search for the always elegant chief maid of the Mansion, Sakuya Izayoi. Always clad in blue maid clothing, Sakuya was easily distinguishable by her glistening silver hair and beautiful blue eyes. With the ability to stop, slow down and speed up time, the duties as a maid were a breeze for Sakuya. While she and Patchouli didn't always see eye to eye, they would still work with each other when the situation called for it.

Eventually, Patchouli found Sakuya, who was busy disciplining a group of unruly fairy maids, the chief maid brandishing her trademark throwing knifes as a symbol of intimidation for her much smaller co-workers. Sakuya's eyes caught Patchouli's purple clothes nearing her, which caused the maid to quickly dismiss the fairy maids in light of her fellow housemate at the Mansion.

"Miss Patchouli? Is something troubling you?" Sakuya asked the magician. She knew that Patchouli very rarely left her library unless something important had occurred.

"Sakuya, I must ask you for a most important favour." Patchouli asked, slightly out of breath despite her use of hovering rather than running. "You know of that Black White magician?"

Sakuya's concerned face turned to an icy frown. "You don't even need to mention her name. I am fully aware of that intolerable witch who forever disturbs m'lady's domain."

Patchouli attempted to smile to bring up the mood. "Well, a new familiar of mine managed to incapacitate her in my library and we have a plan to make it so she won't be a nuisance to us any more."

Sakuya's eyebrows raised up. "Tell me more of your...plan."
1122111.title: She liked it

choices: We shall fatten her up the old fashioned way!
We shall fatten her magically, It's quicker AND Patchouli's forte.
11221111.content:
This was a revolutionary discovery on part of Patchouli and her new familiar, something that could very well rid them of their little witch problem for good. While not directly involved with the library and the inner workings of the magically inclined chamber of books, Sakuya found that it was always in her best interest in finding ways to better improve the security of the Scarlet Devil Mansion and with Marisa constantly finding ways in and out of the library...well, it acted as a persistent blemish on the head maid's record of keeping the mansion, not only in working order, but it's interior free from intruders, thieves and other manners of interlopers who seek to disrupt the residents that lived here.

"Well then, listen to this," Patchouli began, confident in the newest plot to keep Marisa out of their hair for good. "In my time in dealing with Marisa, one of the largest factors of her entrance and escape from me was all thanks to one thing...her speed. All of this time, I've tried keeping Marisa out and each time, she's managed to weasel her way in. However, now the idea shifts to keeping her in."

While Patchouli smirked, the idea still sounding as if it was one of the best epiphanies to happen to the witch in centuries, Sakuya stood by with a skeptical look. The maid wasn't entirely sold on things, mostly from Patchouli mentioning one phrase that perplexed her greatly. "...'keep her in'?" Sakuya echoed, with a raised eyebrow. "Wasn't the plan to keep the witch out of the mansion, Miss Patchouli?"

"Ahh, not quite, Sakuya." Patchouli corrected, having figured the head maid would find her choice of words rather odd. "You see, my newest familiar showed me something a moment ago...something that told me that, the best way to be rid of our little Black White magician is to fatten her up to immobility!" Patchouli concluded, giving to Sakuya the book in which the young imp had given his master. Sakuya gazed at the children's book in a curious manner, turning it to one side as if examining it for anything unusual before, taking a look at the pages within. The maid wasn't exactly an avid reader like Patchouli, she herself finding little time to do so usually because she was often busy catering to the needs of either, the mansion or her mistress. That said, Sakuya wasn't entirely familiar with a lot of stories but, this one however...it seemed to strike a chord of familiarity to her, something she wasn't entirely certain as to why.

"Think about it, if we fatten Marisa up to a point where she can't even move, what choice does she have but to sit on her fattened duff? She can't go anywhere from being so engorged, she can't steal anything from me because she'll be too big to move. It's the perfect plan!" Patchouli explained further, Sakuya swiftly examining the book before she handed it back to the plump witch and took a moment to think on whether this was worth trying or not. At face value, Patchouli's proposition was sound, if a little silly, but with time it could very well keep Marisa from causing any more trouble at the mansion. However, there was still one thing Sakuya felt was worth mentioning...

"What about Danmaku?" The maid inquired, Patchouli perking up at the question. "Marisa may be immobile, but that does not mean she is without magic to use at her leisure. This plan is actually rather good, but we need a way to neutralize her destructive attacks, otherwise, we'll end up with a bloated magician that constantly causes property damages to the mansion and is someone whom we can't get rid of due to the very same girth that's pinned her down."

"No need to worry, I have several methods that will help in dampening, or even nulling, Marisa's destructive power. One of these methods involves her power being stifled for every pound she gains." Patchouli replied, the witch already seeming to be ahead of the maid in her thoughts. Even so, with that out of the way, there was still yet another fork in this road that needed to be passed.

"Very well then, but there's one more thing we must address." said Sakuya, the witch leaning in slightly to hear of what the maid had to offer this time. "How shall we go about fattening Marisa?"

That was a good question, one that would ultimately decide on who would be the one focusing their attention on making Marisa as big as a house. Patchouli stood by, pacing around a bit to think on her answer, only two obvious choices presenting themselves but only one standing out to her...
11221111.title: Best Lard Plans

choices: Skip to Sakuya and Patchouli later on
See what Marisa and the Imp have been up to
112211112.content:
Patchouli gave a snap of her fingers, an idea coming to her brilliant mind. "It's quite simple really, we'll work this like a two woman operation that will use the best of both our expertise and skills. However, this will require for you to work harder than you usually do Sakuya. Do you think you'll be able to handle that?"

"I am always ready for anything Miss Patchouli, especially if it involves the Black White Witch getting what's coming to her." Sakuya replied in a confident tone. "What will you require me to do?"

The purple clad magician cleared her throat, then began another explanation. "There is no doubting your culinary skills, is there Sakuya?"

"I can handle any recipe that is given to me, name it and I will make it." The maid replied.

"Well, that is just what you will doing for this plan Sakuya. Make as many meals you possibly can, try and work your cooking around your usual workload." Patchouli then brought a book out from under her pyjamas. "I have another book that will be highly useful for your task." She passed the heavy book to Sakuya, who began to examine the cover.

"This is another book from the Outside World, is it not?" Sakuya questioned, taking a look inside at some of the pages. "I have never seen meals like this before...."

"Yes, it is a book from the Outside. Inside are recipes for what is commonly referred to as "Fast Food" by humans from there." The magician gave a small chuckle at the very thought of such foods. "Their high calorie count and simple recipes will make this plan work smoothly."

Sakuya closed the book and raised a question. "While I can fulfil my side of your plan all well and good, where do you come into this?"

Patchouli put her hand up, signalling that she knew a response to the Maid's question. "As well as providing that book, I am currently in the process of searching for more of these cookery books that will aid you. Due to my library's size, this could take some time."

Before Sakuya could speak up again, Patchouli added more to her response. "Plus, I shall be working my hand at some enchantments on your cooking. As I previously mentioned, an enchant that will drain Marisa's magical abilities will be added, but that is not all. Koakuma haw been assisting me as well and she was able to find a perfectly good hunger enchant in my tomes. With this handy magic, the more one eats, the hungrier one becomes!" The purple witch clapped her hands together, pleased with herself at the moment.

Sakuya gave a nod of approval. "This plan sounds good to me, I cannot see how this could fail us." The always elegant maid began to walk away, the Outside World cooking book in hand. "I shall begin gathering the ingredients required for these new meals right away. When your enchants are perfected, come to the main kitchen as soon as you can." Taking a pocket watch from one of her compartments, Sakuya disappeared in a flash, leaving Patchouli to make her way back to the library.
112211112.title: We shall fatten her magically, It's quicker!

1122111121.content:
Though it had taken several hours of hard work getting together ingredients and cooking, Patchouli was more than impressed by Sakuya's handiwork at making all of the luscious outside world food that would soon be enchanted by the combination spell the magician had made.

"The recipes were not too difficult to read or understand, so I was able to cook them quickly and efficiently." Sakuya told as she added a few finishing touches to her products.

"Another reason I decided outside world food was best." Patchouli replied, flicking through her spell book to the correct page. When she got there, she saw the enchant she had made, a combination of the hunger increasing spell and the magic decreasing spell. It was a little tough to get right even with Koakuma's help, so she hoped that it would work just fine.

Letting her mind drift into a state of emptiness, Patchouli looked over the vast amounts of food and began chanting the spell. The piles of juicy burgers and succulent steaks, the treats smothered in chocolate and drenched in sugar, the containers filled to the brim with syrup and peanut butter, every piece of delicious food lay before the master magician as she recalled the spell as loud as her weak voice could allow her to.

When the enchant was completely recalled, Patchouli floated back down to the floor, a little uneasy as the chants had drained her of her strength. The magical essence of the spell, personified in a golden powder, fluttered onto the many foodstuffs below, every single item of food now enchanted.

Regaining her balance, Patchouli surveyed the many meals. "I did find that enchant quite hard to create, I'd feel safer if we got ourselves a test of the food to see if it all worked. If it doesn't work, Marisa is sure to be suspicious of us with all this food."

Sakuya nodded. "Oh yes, good thinking. Just who could we use as a testing subject?"

(PS: This was going to be much longer but Writing's web server cocked up on me so it didn't submit and I lost all my original writing. Sorry for this very lazy re-write.)
1122111121.title: Skip to Sakuya and Patchouli later on

choices: Hold up, before with do that...
11221111211.content:
Standing tall with her arms crossed, Hong Meiling stood her ground next to the entrance gate to the Scarlet Devil Mansion. Today had been quite uneventful, so she decided to have her daily nap earlier than usual, allowing her to be wide awake for the rest of her duties that day.

Approaching the gate with a tray of enchanted food in hand, Sakuya eagerly awaited the results of Patchouli's spellcasting to see if the food she had created and allowed to be enchanted was suitable for the cunning plan to get Marisa out of their hair once and for all.

Pulling the gates open to get through, Meiling was alerted of Sakuya's movement and gave an approving grin. "Hey there Sakuya! Isn't it a bit early to be having lunch? Either way I'm not complaining!" Meiling eyed up the many foods on the tray with hungry eyes.

"I've decided to make something a little different today, so I thought it'd be best to share it with you earlier." Sakuya approached the gatekeeper and brandished the tray right before her. "I would love to know what you think of these meals. They're many delicacies from the outside world."

Meiling took a slice of pizza from the tray and looked at it gleefully. "Wow....this looks great! Sure thing Sakuya, I'll gladly let you know what I think." The elegant maid looked on silently as Meiling took the slice and took several bites from it.

Sakuya smiled as she heard the moans of pleasure come from Meiling, followed be her quickly eating the rest of the slice. "That....That was divine! It's the best thing I've ever tasted!"

"If you liked that, then this whole tray is yours for the taking." Sakuya beamed as she handed the many foods to Meiling. "There's plenty of other new foods for you to try!"

In a flash, the tray was snatched from her hands as Meiling sat down against the wall and began to devour the other meals that rested on the tray. Loud chews and pleased moans were all that could be heard from her as Sakuya looked on. Allowing her fellow colleague to eat in peace, the maid closed the gates behind her and made her way back to the Mansion to tell Patchouli the good news.

"It really worked?" The magician asked excitedly.

"Oh yes, Meiling started stuffing her face the moment she tasted a morsel."

"Excellent! Let's serve those meals to Marisa at once! Let's start our plan so she'll never bother us again!" Patchouli rushed to her library as fast as she could, quickly disappearing from sight.

Sakuya pondered. "Hmmm...guess I'll need to make sure Meiling gets fed regularly too....better make sure she can still walk though..." With that thought, she took another tray of calorie caked treats and made her way to the library as well.
11221111211.title: Meiling

112211112112.content:
"Sakuya? Where's my pot of tea?"

With a slight pout on her face, the Scarlet Devil herself Remilia Scarlet was making her way to the kitchen, looking for her usually organised head maid. She huffed as she looked in several rooms to no avail, meaning more time needed looking for her.

"How can a lady enjoy her afternoons without a lovely cup of tea? I could do with a slice of cake while I'm at it..."

Finally, the vampire was now at the kitchen, opening the doors to the room. Her eyes widened as she marveled the many dishes laid out on the tables, though none of the food actually intended for her consumption.

"Why, how thoughtful of Sakuya to do this for me! So many rich meals all lined up for me, it's wonderful!"

Following her nose to the most delectable of the foods, Remilia found herself face to face with a pile of chocolate bars, all based around the many different tastes each brand followed. Remilia rounded her tongue around her lips in anticipation. Picking one of the bars up, she took a greedy bite and gleamed happily as she chewed away in pleasure.

"Such tantalizing treats! I can forgive Sakuya for forgetting my pot of tea, these heavenly bars are more than a suitable substitute!" Taking the plate of chocolate bars, Remilia rushed back to her tea room to enjoy the rest of her afternoon meal.
112211112112.title: Hold up, before with do that...

choices: Cut to a few days later
Cut to a few weeks later
1122111121121.content:
As both Patchouli and Sakuya entered the library once again, they spotted Marisa attempting to chatter with the new imp familiar. Having shown that he did not hold the ability to speak, it was mostly just Marisa talking to herself with no response. Patchouli didn't mind the annoyance of her constant talking, as she knew that very soon Marisa would be stuffing her mouth full of calorie filled treats.

Marisa noticed the return of the duo. "Oh, heya both. It's been kinda boring here, with your little friend here not saying a syllable. Maybe next time a familiar that can talk would be better? His magic is nice and all, but the no talkie thing doesn't fly with me. Maybe you could be a good little asthmatic youkai and let me go now?"

"Me and Sakuya have been thinking of keeping you here for a little while. Can't be having a little thief like yourself running around being a nuisance now, can we?" Patchouli signaled for Sakuya to approach with her tray in hand. The various fattening foods were presented to the young witch.

"Since you will be staying with us for some time, it makes sense to keep you fed. Consider this your lunch for the day." Sakuya smiled as she put the tray on the nearest table.

Marisa's eyes instantly lit up. "Oh wow, I wasn't expecting this! You call this keeping me hostage? Where's the luxury clothing and expensive wines while you're at it!"

Patchouli leaned over to Sakuya. "Marisa is never one to miss a free meal. About what she said....make sure to sew some plus sized clothing for when she inevitably outgrows her current dress...." The purple haired girl didn't like the concept of having Marisa as a naked jiggling mess in her library.

Deespite being binded to the chair by the powers of the imp, Marisa could still use her arms freely. Taking a sugar coated doughnut from the tray Sakuya presented her, she sunk her teeth into it and began to chew, A very pleased look appeared on her face, followed by her wolfing the rest of it down followed by licking her lips and fingers for excess powder.

"Damn Sakuya....I knew you were a good cook but that was fantastic! I've been missing out on some quality food not coming to you!"

Patchouli gleefully looked onwards as the tray gradually became empty, her hostage happily gorging herself on the many delicacies from the outside world. She made short work of the food before her, only taking ten minutes to eat it all. Licking her fingers once more, Marisa gave a thumbs up to the maid.

"If this is how I'll be treated, I'm just fine with your little captivity game you're playing Patchy."

"Well, we can't let you go starving while you're here, right?" Patchouli replied. "We'll have some more food up for you later, okay? See you then!" She hovered away with Sakuya in tow, leaving Marisa and the Imp alone.

"It worked perfectly! She ate that so fast, I can't imagine what she'll be like when the full hunger sets in!"

"I'll make sure there's enough food to keep her occupied." Sakuya responded. "I do wonder if the Shrine Maiden will look into things if Marisa disappears for long enough." She warned.

"We'll cross that bridge when we get to it. Right now all I care about is getting that nuisance fattened up and make sure her magic is sapped too. Soon enough she'll be nothing more that an useless immobile blob..." The magician giggled to herself as she and the head maid walked out of the library.
1122111121121.title: Now it's Marisa's turn!

choices: See what someone else is up to.
11221111211211.content:
Another day had begun in Gensokyo, the sun rolling across the hills to bring it's warmth for the future hours. Naturally up early and properly dressed, Sakuya walked through the mansion to prepare everyone for the following day. Having worked with Patchouli actively over the past days, she decided it would be best to wake her up first. Her magical abilities had proved to be vastly useful in their plan against Marisa, so another early morning batch of the enchanted food would be easy to create.

Entering the bedchamber of the magician, Sakuya lit the candles in the room and approached the bed Patchouli slept in. She lifted the covers and let her stir in her own time and pace. Eventually, she awoke.

"Oh.....Miss Sakuya..." She groaned, clearly sleepy. "Is it morning already?...."

"Indeed it is. If you could so kindly wake so we can create more of Marisa's meals. The plan has been going swimmingly as of late!"

Patchouli smiled. "I am too pleased with the progress. Let us begin shortly...."

Rising out of her bed using her magic, Patchouli hovered over to the desk of her bedroom. While the tired girl did lose her balance while hovering, swinging left and right while almost crashing into the wall, she still made it over to her dressing table.

"Shall I assist you in dressing yourself Lady Patchouli?" Sakuya offered. Being the head maid, she tried to be as helpful as possible. She avidly assisted Remilia in dressing herself, along with the occasional help for Patchouli if she desired.

"Yes please Sakuya...." From the huge yawn she let out, it was clear why she wanted the help. Removing her worn nightgown she had slept in, a cause for concern gripped Sakuya.

Patchouli's body had shrunk greatly. Sakuya knew her body type. She had always been on the larger side, years of staying in the library moulded her figure to be quite plump. But now that was all gone, her body now looking painfully thin. Her backbone jutted out on her skin, her rear was tiny compared to it's once jiggling mass. Through the mirror of the room, Sakuya could spy deflated breasts and visible ribs.

"Lady Patchouli! What on earth have you done to yourself?!" The elegant maid exclaimed.

Patchouli looked down at herself, then waved a bony hand nonchalantly. "It is nothing Miss Sakuya. Just a side effect of the spells I've been doing. I assure you, everything is just fi-"

Her sentence would cut off by Sakuya dragging the much thinner girl from her room all the way to the kitchen. Patchouli's magic was unable to focus at this time, causing her to alternate between hovering and walking, though being dragged all the while.

"You are ill enough as it is Lady Patchouli!" Sakuya yelled. "I will not have you risking your health like this! If you do wish to continue with this, then I must keep you well!"

She sat the partially naked girl onto a chair in the kitchen, followed by clawing her way through the pantries of the room. Many of the outside world delicacies lay on a table on the other side of the kitchen, obviously intended for their meddling guest. For Patchouli, Sakuya created many of her usual meals, a variety of meats and sponge cakes. Being a talented chef, this did not take long to make.

Presenting the large spread to Patchouli, Sakuya stared at her. "From now on, you will be kept on a strict diet. You must eat all the food I serve you, no matter how much it is. If you fail to follow this, I will be to resort to forcefeeding. Do you understand Lady Patchouli?"

Taking note of the maid's concern for her well being, Patchouli did indeed understand. "Yes I do. From now on, I will eat what you desire me to." While she was intimidated by the sheer size of the portion she had, as well as what else Sakuya had in store for her, she knew better than to anger her by disobeying. Taking the first dish prepared for her, Patchouli began to eat it with a quick pace.

"I am glad you are going along with this. Just remember, this is more for your own well being than it is for the success of our plan." Sakuya reminded her. With that, she remembered that Marisa was set for her now daily fattening breakfast. Taking the trays of outside world food from the table, she made her way to the library.

"They're not enchanted due to Lady Patchouli's situation, but they should still bulk her up well." She thought as she made her way there.
11221111211211.title: Cut to a few days later

choices: Sakuya checks up on another character
112211112112111.content:
Making her way along the red carpeted hallways with trays in both hands, Sakuya carefully traversed into the library. It had seen became a rather lively place due to the addition of a loudmouth magician, but thankfully she'd been too busy enjoying the vast amounts of meals supplied to her to cause any kind of ruckus. Even so early on in her and Patchouli's plans, Sakuya felt much more at peace knowing that regular break ins into the mansion would be a thing of the past, no longer feeling as much stress as she would before due to the near daily occurrence. Bringing the trays inside, Sakuya spotted the captive. Marisa sat in her bound chair with hungry eyes focused on the various foods all presented and all for her.

"Mornin' Sakuya! Looks tasty as usual!" Marisa greeted as she lifted her hands up in preparation for gorging.

"Good morning to you too Marisa." Sakuya bowed. "Today you have pancakes with a variety of spreadables. Do enjoy"

When the trays were placed on the nearby table, Marisa wasted no time pouring syrup onto the pancakes and hungrily eating away at them. Sakuya smiled as she witnessed the food massacre, taking a look at the black white magician. Only a few days in and the enchanted food was doing it's magic, as clearly visible on the girl. The curve of her belly could be seen through her clothes, along with her breasts looking rounder and more defined in the fabric. Her face had plumped out slightly, along with her arms sporting extra flab. It was early days, but it was a sure fire sign that the fattening was working. There was no doubts in anyone's mind that the hunger enchantments were working, as Marisa near demolished the breakfast before her with no regard for cutlery, using her hands to shovel food in her mouth.

"Mmmpgh....how do you make your food so delicious..." Marisa moaned between bites, causing Sakuya to put a hand to her chest.

"You flatter me Marisa. I shall be back when you are finished to collect your tray. Dinner shall be ready soon." With another bow, the elegant maid left once more. Her mind cast to the future, envisioning just how large the witch would end up with an eating rate like that.
112211112112111.title: Sakuya tends to Marisa.

choices: ...her Mistress, making it very clear where all the sweets have gone.
... the butler, with the Mistress tied to the bed behind him.
...a seemingly magical force that seemed somewhat connected to the butler.
113.content:
What, or else who laid before her, surprised her visibly. It was, as it seemed, a normal human, dressed into attire not unlike that of a butler's. She immediately associated it's posture and gaze with Sakuya's. "I guess this happens sometimes too.", she thought to herself as she eyed the figure.

After a brief while, she managed to spot a tail, tied to the demon's back. As this was the only indication of the creature's demonic origin, she decided to call him only "butler". When this examination process ended, the butler spoke: "I have been ushered into existence from realms unspoken into a single purpose: serving my Mistress. Even such is my loyalty that any other purpose given to me by Her word will be obeyed in the absolute."

She grinned visibly in satisfaction. This will work nicely. "I command thee to serve me in every aspect of my being, and that is your purpose.", she spoke in a grandiose tone. He nodded and placed himself in the corner of the room, awaiting her next command. Quite pleased, her first command was: "Prepare me dinner!".

A week had passed. Koakuma aimlessly roamed the halls of the library. She hadn't seen her master in person now for an entire week. While this would usually be nothing to arouse suspicion, she had another valid reason to worry.

While the Mistress never came outside out of her own volition, she did so out of necessity. Food would always be prepared on a shared table, the only thing Sakuya had been willing to serve her personally had been tea. But now, she would quite frequently spotted the new butler bringing meals right to Patchouli's quarters. And these meals were getting ever more frequent. This day she already noticed plates of cookies, chocolate, slices of tender meat and so on, all headed to her rooms, and it wasn't even noon yet.

She could somewhat tolerate this "room service", but she also worried for the Mistresses' health. Every plate, filled with only sweets, junk food, meat products and refreshments, returned to the kitchen emptied.

She was thinking of this of this as she walked past The Lady's private quarters' doors. She couldn't help but notice that the doors weren't properly shut, so she attempted to close them. At this moment, a hand grabs her from inside, pulling her into the room and slamming the door behind her.

The person, who pulled her hand, was...
113.title: A diligent demon Maid/Butler

choices: It was her other familiar, Koa.
It was hard to tell. Might as well wait for visual confirmation
115.content:
Patchouli waved her arm in front of her face to dispatch some of the smoke as a result of the summoning spell. And..

"What the..." Coughed a male voice, light and worried. "W-Where am I! What's with this smoke!"

The purplette quirked her eye as she smoke soon cleared, and she got a good luck at what she had summoned.

It was male, and looked to be a bit taller than her...

And a smidge wider too. She saw large hips and the hint of a belly as the smoke cleared and the person's figure came to like.

He had a soft cherubic face, round but not truly fat. His hair was considerably short, it's color black. Patchouli caught his eyes staring right at her purple. He was wearing what looked like a white button up shirt which was nicely buttoned over a large and soft stomach, and she could see the faint outlines of his moobs. Looking down, she saw him wearing an oblong blue pants of some rough material and sneakers.

"Odd. You don't really look like a familiar," said Patchouli as she walked up and inspected the taller man.

"H-Hey!" The young man cried out "W-Who are you! What's going on? Where am I?"

The avid reader and magician walked up to him, her looking up at the taller boy. And she put a finger into his gut, her digit sinking into his flab making him flinch.

"H-hey..."

"You don't seem to be suit that much for combat. May I ask what your name and profession is?" Asked the girl.

"My name and profession?" Asked the boy. "Well...my name is Ken Yamamoto, and I'm a chef."

Patchouli's normally dull face brightened up for a second, then returned to her passive look.

"Very well, that will suit just fine."

All of a sudden, the sound of a door opened and Patchouli recognized the voice of the person murmuring by the door to the library...
115.title: A human?! A chubby one at that!

choices: Enough of this, skip to next morning!
1151.content:
Rubbing her temple with one hand, the young elegant maid that was Sakuya Izayoi entered the grand library. Known for her expertise in housekeeping, which ranged from cooking, to cleaning, to dealing with unwanted guests in the mansion, she was also known for her abilities with time itself, being able to slow down and speed up pockets of time, which was handy for growing crops amongst other things. Plus, the time powers allowed her to also stop the flow of time itself, leaving all but herself frozen in place, which proved very handy during combat situations.

Still wearing her usual blue and white maid uniform, symbolising she was still working at such a late hour, she covered her mouth to block a yawn as she approached the magician and the young man she had whisked to her quarters.

"Miss Patchouli, what are you doing at such an hour? I heard a great fuss from upstairs so I came down to see what was going on." Sakuya gave a glance upwards. "Thank goodness you didn't wake the mistress, she gets in a foul mood when she doesn't get enough sleep." Soon, her eyes laid sight to Ken, who was still dumbstruck at the whole experience. "Oh, this is an unfamiliar face. Mind explaining who this fellow is?"

"He tells me his name is Ken." The purple haired girl slowly made her way back over to her reading desk. "Seems he was brought here when I was trying to conjure up a new familiar. As you can see...." Another finger pressed into Ken's pudgy belly, earning a yelp from him. "....he is not prime familiar material."

Sakuya nodded, staring intently at Ken as he rubbed his gut in hopes of soothing the painful poke he received. "Yes, I can see that clearly. As expected of someone from the outside world. I can tell from his clothes." She walked over to Ken, continuing her glare over him as she circled around his wide body. "Tell me Miss Patchouli, does he claim to be skilled in any fields?"

"He did inform me that he has a profession as a chef, so the male has knowledge of cookery." The magician rubbed her weary eyes, readjusting her hat as well.

A small smile then crept onto Sakuya's face, a glint appearing in her sapphire eyes. "Perhaps this man could be of some use to us...."
1151.title: It was her maid, Sakuya

choices: Hmmm? Someone else is coming as they arrive in the kitchen! But who?
11511.content:
"Hiiiiii~!"

Sakuya sighed, bringing a hand to her face to pinch the bridge of her nose. She was here.

"Ah," Patchouli said. "Hello Koakuma. You've been away quite a bit." Ken turned around, and saw a flying succubus with red hair along with bat wings: on both her head and on her back. She had a very happy and playful air around her.

"Sorry~, was out for a bath is all! A girls need a path every now and then! Oh!" Koakuma noticed the tall plump human and inspected him, fluttering around him.

"Ummm...hi?"

Koakuma's reply was a poke to his tummy, making Ken groan a bit. "H-Hey..."

"Wow! That's cushy!" Mentioned the succubus, intriuged by Ken's marshmallow tummy. "Can I play with it?"

Before Ken could answer, Sakuya stepped in. "Ken here is not a toy, but a familiar. His work is devoted to Lady Pathchouli, not to spend wasteful time. Understood?"

Koakuma huffed.

"So then...want me to start cooking for you all?" He asked. His answer was a growl in the tummy of Patchouli.

"Yes. Lets."
11511.title: Koakuma enters the scene!

115111.content:
Leading him into the main kitchen of the mansion, Sakuya presented the basics of where everything was in the area. Despite the lack of electric technology, there were still plenty of resources for a chef to use in cookery.

"Eeeh?" Koakuma had followed them into the kitchen, curious about the new person in their presence. "Why is the chubby guy making a late night snack?"

"We're seeing if he has any talents worthy of use. He claims he is skilled in cookery, so we are asking him to cook." Patchouli looked on at the explanations Sakuya was giving Ken. "Even if he isn't skilled, he'll still give the Mistress and her sister a good meal."

"Awww, don't kill him!" The devilish girl whined. "I wanna have some fun with him!" A hand was clamped over her mouth shortly after from her superior.

"Do be quiet." Patchouli scolded. "The human is about to start."

"So, now you have the basics sorted." The always elegant maid noted. "Please, show us your culinary work."

"Okay, I'll get working..." Though he was still trying to wrap his head around the whole situation, he understood that if he was able to cook a quality set for the girls, he'd at least get in their good books.

All three females watched in anticipation as Ken got started with his cooking. Using the ingredients at his disposal, he worked on roasting meat, chopping vegetables and kneading dough. The moment he was done with one task, he moved right onto the next. His speed and swiftness was surprising for his chubby frame, seemingly no factor in the effort he put in. Aromas soon filled the air, a short preview of just what kinds of meals he was intending to make.

"Sakuya...you did make sure to check that meat, right?" Patchouli asked, somewhat nervous.

"What would be the matter with it Miss Patchouli?" Sakuya responded, confused at what possibly could be the matter.

"Well, we have both animal meats and meats that the Mistress...enjoys. She enjoys her own from less reliable sources..."

"Oh, I see what you mean now." Sakuya waved her hand and smiled. "Not to fear, I've made sure it's not that kind of meat. I run a perfect shift in this household." However, the confidence Patchouli had in her statement didn't last long. "Besides, a little cannibalism never hurt anyone."

Late into the night, Ken cooked away, While Sakuya stayed wide awake to keep a sharp eye on him, Patchouli and Koakuma had begun snoozing away, both lying face down on a table. Their slumber didn't last long, as they were woken by an announcement.

"I've finished my creations." Ken took a seat and rested, clearly worn out from excessive cooking.

The silver haired girl looked down at the cooking area. He had certainly outdone himself, with a full spread of meals on display. Roast dinners of beef and vegetables were common on the table. Pork inside pastry was also very prominent. Skewers in shish kebab style piled on top of each other. Specific parts of meats were focused upon, with plates of bacon strips and bowls of chicken legs. It was grand feast which surprising the girls.

"Oh wow....it all looks so good!" Koakuma was near salivating at the foods before her.

"It certainly is a vast amount..." Patchouli noted. Her stomach roared in anticipation.

"Let's just hope it lives up to expectations." Moving over, Sakuya took a part of the huge spread and sampled it's flavour.
115111.title: Ken cooks up a smogisborg!

choices: Koa is estatic and Sakuya allows it.
Sakuya is against it. Koa goes for the sisters, Ken for Meiling.
1151111.content:
Sakuya's stoic eyes lit up, finger still in her mouth. This was only from the sauces of the roast!

Koakuma fluttered over and saw Sakuya's silence. "Well~, is it good?"

The maid looked up at the succubus. "Yes...incredibly so!" She turned towards Patchouli. "Master, this food is sufficient and tastes remarkable! I suggest we begin our dinner right away!"

The bag-eyed librarian nodded. "Okay." She turned towards Koakuma. "Koa. Do be a dear and find the Scarlet sisters please."

"Awww! But I wanna taste the soft human's food!"

"The Scarlet Sisters? Who are they?" Asked Ken as he sat up a little. The devil familiar of Patchouli hung close to him.

"Well, they are the owners of this mansion! Remilia is the owner of the mansion, and her sister is named Flandre!"

"But I thought Patchouli was the owner," said the human as he pointed towards the violetnette, who shrugged.

"Eh. I'm just a friend of hers. She allows me to make the Library my home. And Sakuya is also Remilia's maid." The maid who had sat herself down nodded.

"Yes indeed." She turned towards the human. "Ken, if possible, could you go retrieve Hong Meiling? She is the mansion's guardian."

"Ummm...I guess." He also turned towards the down Koakuma. "Hey Koakuma, you can go eat if you like, I can find these sisters and this Meiling fellow."
1151111.title: It tastes great! Sakuya approves!

12.content:
Yuyuko rolled over in bed. Being awake is an experience to be avoided, as Yukari Yakumo always said, but something was off this morning. The pink haired spirit checked her alarm.

three 'o clock...

In the afternoon?

No that couldn't be right... her servant, a half ghost by the name of Youmu Konpaku would have awoken her... unless...

Yuyuko pulled on her Kimono, pausing for a moment to admire herself in the glass of her mirror.

she was tall, very tall for a woman. Six feet of pink haired ghost stood before the mirror, showing only the truth:

Yuyuko had curves. Curves upon curves. Her hips were flared, her breasts were full, yet her arms were slender and elegant; a remarkable feature.
The ghost princess had an hourglass figure: a pair of mountainous breasts that jiggled slightly with each breath, counterbalanced by a rear that wreaked havoc on armchairs,often breaking the arms by pushing them outwards.

her figure would have been perfect if not for the slight overhang of her belly, pushing out against her Kimono ever so slightly.

She prodded it gingerly. So soft... The way it rippled underneath her touch was...

"Ah!" Yuyuko gasped out loud.

"Youmu! I forgot about her!"

and with that, she walked briskly to the Kitchen.

No Youmu.

across the house, through the dining hall and into the washroom.

No Youmu there either.

Finally, she took a step outside, and standing on the porch was...

nobody.

She was alone.

Yuyuko Saigyouji, ghost princess of Hagyokurou, was truly alone...

truly free to do what she wanted.

The pink haired bombshell looked around, smiling giddily.

Freedom!

but what to do?
12.title: Hagyokurou, dawn

choices: Meats, vegetables, fruits, and other basic ingredients.
121.content:
"If Youmu's gone, then that means I can have whatever I want from the kitchen!" Yuyuko said to herself. Although Yuyuko had a massive appetite, the hungry ghost princess rarely went to her own kitchen to make herself a meal; mainly because she bosses Youmu to cook food for her whenever she gets hungry. But with Youmu nowhere to be found in Hagyokurou, Yuyuko can easily have the chance to know what it feels like to get food on her own.

Yuyuko went back to the kitchen to see what she could find. The kitchen was lined with pantries filled with ingredients that went into the making of Yuyuko's meals. Next to the pantries laid a fairly large fridge, encased in white silver and looming over the kitchen like an ominous monolith. That fridge happened to be a gift from her friend Yukari Yakumo, and Yuyuko recalled Yukari explaining that a fridge was a device from the Outside World used to preserve large amounts of food for long periods of time through cold temperatures and the fridge being "a perfect gift for a bottomless pit of a stomach like you", whatever that means. Still, the importance of the fridge must mean that all of the tasty meals must be in there! Yuyuko then went to the fridge and opened both of the doors wide open. The blast of cold air emitting from the fridge to her voluptuous body reminded Yuyuko of that one time when she decided to steal spring to make the Saigyou Ayakashi bloom, but she decided that is not important to remember now. Food is the main objective!

Yuyuko scanned the entire fridge for a meal to eat. So far, she found:
121.title: Fridge Raider

choices: Maybe...just one slice. Youmu won't notice that...hopefully?
Before she could decide, Yuyuko feels a tap on her shoulder.
1212.content:
As the cold air continued to bellow from the fridge, the nipples on Yuyuko's exposed heaving breasts hardened...but it wasn't the air that caused them to harden.

It was the sight of a large circular shape on the very top shelf of the fridge, brown in color and giving off the most wonderful of scents. It smelled like...chocolate. Maybe it was chocolate! But Yuyuko had only seen and eaten small pieces of candied chocolate, never one at this scale before! It was bigger than a wagon wheel and thicker too! Yuyuko marveled at the chocolate confection, still not knowing what it is, but she knew how to find out. She didn't visit the kitchen often, but she remembered that Yukari had sent her Shikigami Ran over several weeks ago, giving Yuyuko some news about what's going on in Gensokyo and leaving Youmu with several 'magazines', tall and thin booklets with pictures in them. She remembered spying on Youmu after Ran had left that day and saw Youmu stuff the magazines in one of the kitchen drawers. There were only so many drawers in this kitchen...how hard could it be to find a few books?

Evidently, very. Yuyuko struggled to open most of the these drawers, not because she was out of shape (even though she was), but because Youmu was a very organized person, especially in the kitchen. Each drawer was tightly packed with tools and utensils, so tightly that upon prying open drawers 2 and 3, she narrowly avoiding being skewered by several knifes & cleavers that came flying out of each of them, most of which only tore holes in Yuyuko's already loose and open robe, one of which tore the cloth right between her legs, exposing her large ass if she were to bend down.

It took a total 45 minutes for Yuyuko to wriggle the 4th drawer in the kitchen open, by which point Yuyuko had worked up a mighty sweat, which was thankfully cooled by still open Fridge. Inside the 4th drawer were the thin booklets that Youmu had stashed! Yippee! Now Yuyuko could see what this massive treat was. Flipping through the pages, Yuyuko tried not to get distracted by the delicious looking pictures, focused on finding this large chocolate wheel. Halfway through the 2nd magazine, she spotted the picture she was looking for. A large, chocolate wheel, complete with a recipe...the treat was called a 'cake'. A section of small text below the picture caught her attention; 'Chocolate Cake, the go to treat for the Birthday Bash of your beloved!' "Birth..day?", Yuyuko asked aloud.

As a ghost who had been sealed in a youkai tree for hundreds of years, Yuyuko couldn't quite remember what a 'birthday" was, but she knew it was some kind of party. So, this 'cake' was for a festivity dedicated to someone else...it was likely from one of their friends, but Yuyuko could stop thinking about eating it. A piece of chocolate that large, that tasty, that...moist...

UUUUUUUURRRRGH! Yuyuko jumped at the sudden noise, her vast womanly assets bouncing as she did. Thinking she'd been caught, she flung the magazine down the floor and hid under one of the tall white marble counters...after several minutes, Yuyuko caught her breath and came out for under the counter. Looking around, the lights were still off...but the door to the fridge has been shut! If no one was there, then how could that be?

Heading to the fridge, Yuyuko opened it and started at the tremendous chocolate cake...eyes widening and mouth watering Yuyuko took the cake from the top shelf and carried it over to the counter. Taking in its size and aroma, Yuyuko could barely hold herself back...
1212.title: A large chocolate cake.

choices: "I still have the rest of the chocolate to eat!"
12122.content:
Yuyuko couldn't possibly hold back anymore, her stomach growling with excitement. She cut herself a sizeable portion of the cake and put it on a silver platter.

Eyeing the piece, she first licked the cream off of the top, dirtying her mouth in the process, but she didn't care. She bit into the cake like a predator bites into its pray. Her beautiful kimono got dirtier with every bite she took, but it mattered not to Yuyuko.

The chocolate was exquisite. Even to a connoiseur, it was one of a kind, much more so to Yuyuko. Youmu never allowed her sweets so she had to sneak them by, but this time she was unchained. Unleashed. Still hungry.

Before she knew, the platter was empty. Instinctively, she bit into the rest of the cake, not even caring to cut it up. In her delirious state, she devoured the humongous cake. As she tried to guide every piece into her mouth, the platter on which the cake has been set tipped over, all of it spilling on her.

This startled her as she dropped on the floor, chocolate everywhere. Finally somewhat snapping out of it, she noticed something has changed.

What laid before her was a large bulbous mass, violently protruding through her kimono, all covered in chocolate. She inevitably arrived to the shocking conclusion: This must be her belly. As the calories were fresh, the fat has had yet to settle, at the moment forming what one would describe as a belly of a "lady in her 8th month". Yuyuko affectionately stroked this food baby, the baby seemingly reacting by growling.

While doing so, her belly has begun to slowly lose its tense spherical shape. What she noticed as a result of that were her breasts. Funnily enough, like you get used to looking at your nose, she has gotten used to ingoring her two melon-sized breasts, but she couldn't anymore.

They now pushed aside the kimono and jumped out into the open, finally enjoying their freedom. She untied the obi that had been restricting her growth up until now. Sagging slightly, her milk tanks rested slightly on her stomach, even surpassing it somewhat.

As chocolate also has the effects of an amphrodisiac, her next course of action was only obvious.
12122.title: Can't wait, eat it all....NOW

choices: Youmu, a stern and tired look on her face as usual.
Youmu...but something feels strange about her...
12123.content:
Gazing down at the cake, Yuyuko was entranced...so much...chocolate! It no longer mattered if it had been made for someone else, she needed this wonderful delicacy called Cake inside her, NOW!

Picking up one of the many discarded knifes off from the floor, Yuyuko slowly lowered the blade's edge into the chocolaty surface, mouth watering like a fountain. Placing the large slice onto her plate, Yuyuko prepared to dig in, fork en route to the slice...when her motion was interrupted by a light tap on her shoulder.

Yuyuko spoke to the person she sensed behind her. "H-hello? Youmu?" "Why yes, Yuyuko-sama..." Turning to face the voice, Yuyuko's face was met with the edge of a steel blade! "...I am right here.".

Holding the blade to her was:
12123.title: Guess who's hooo~me?

choices: "I will bake another cake tomorrow. Now...let's eat THIS cake together!"
"Well, since it already has your saliva on it...it's all yours, Yuyuko-sama..."
121231.content:
Yuyuko's suspicions were correct, as the wielder of the blade was none other than her loyal half-ghost retainer, Youmu! Though with the amount of duties she had around her, the term 'servant' might be more accurate...Resting on Youmu's face were tired eyes, though this was a normal look for her on Tuesdays; Maintaining her scornful look directed at Yuyuko she sheathed her long blade, readying to lecture her Lady. Before she could begin, Yuyuko pounced on Youmu, immersing her in hug, "Youm~uuu! Thank goodness you're back! There was this horrible noise that scared me half to re-death! And then you scared me even closer to it, but it's ok, cus you are baaaack!" As Yuyuko's hug continues, The statuesque spirit's mountainous breasts situated themselves on either side of Youmu's white-haired head...

Despite the fact she should be used to this, with innumerable years of serving Yuyuko under her proverbial belt...Youmu could never not be uncomfortable whenever it happened, this moment being no exception. "Yuyuko-sama...please. Let...go...of...me!" After several more minutes, Youmu squirmed her way out of Yuyuko's embrace. Catching her breath, she was finally able to get a word in edgewise to her Lady; "gasp...gasp...gasp...Yes, cough, Yuyuko-sama, I have returned. I was only gone for maybe...2 Hours? To be honest, I'm surprised to find you awake even at this hour. Ordinarily, you sleep until 1 in the afternoon. I'm not, however, surprised to see you in the kitchen...And to find you attempting to eat the cake I made, but I'll return to that later. First, why did you open all these drawers, my knives are splayed in all directions now! Was it to slice the cake? And can you not do something as simple as dressing yourself? Just because you had the manor to yourself, doesn't mean you can walk around with a wide open robe! For goodness sake, did your sense of decency die when you did?!" Youumu looked down, gripping the bridge of her nose, only to lift her face back towards the direct of her Lady, where it displayed an even more intense stern look of frustration...""Yuyuko-sama...just...what were you doing?"

"Oh..my..." Yuyuko became timid at the conclusion of Youmu's tirade, "I...I became elated when it dawned on me that I had the manor to myself, so I made my way into the kitchen...you normally don't let me in here. I'm not dumb...I know why. And when I saw the cake, I had never laid my eyes on one before, so I just had to know what it was, so I snooped in the drawers to find those magazines...After that, I couldn't contain myself, I just wanted one bite! Ohhhhh...Youmu! I'm sooo sorryyyy!!" By the end of her defense, Yuyuko's voice had become a painfully saddened whimper, looking downwards as she spoke and poking her fingertips together. This, in combination with her round delicate face, made for an adorable display that made Youmu feel guilty for scolding her...

Yuyuko was now on her knees, the open nature of her damaged robe granting visibility to her nipples & inner thighs, much to Youmu's embarrassment. Yuyuko was almost on the verge of tears when Youmu decided to console her, knowing that she couldn't let her Lady become so glum. Kneeling down to Yuyuko's level, she stroked her fluffy cherry-pink locks, calming her. Looking up to face Youmu, she saw that where tired and angered eyes were once kept now rested a gentle & empathetic gaze, a soft smile on Youmu's lips below. "Yuyuko-sama...I should be the one apologizing to you. I don't remember the last time I had ever spoken to you like that...it was likely after the incident we managed to cause, and even then, I only scolded you so I wouldn't feel any guilt about helping you steal the Spring. This time...I have no excuse..." "Y-Youmu..." "I haven't finished...you see, I had made that cake only after Ran-san had granted me those magazines. It seemed like a great gift for someone. It's for that Reisen girl, over at Eintei in the Bamboo Forest? I...like her. Very heavily. And although it's hard to tell how old a Lunarian is, I've overheard that her birthday was soon. So I made it for her. And when I saw you had almost eaten it, I was furious! But I didn't have much right to be...I know you, so I should have expected this."

"Oh, Youmu, I didn't know you liked someone! This news...makes be even more upset!" Almost crying again, Youmu acted quick before her Lady could. "No! No no no no! Yuyuko-sama, You shouldn't be upset! " "W-why?" "Because I can always make another one." Yuyuko's face beamed with a happiness brighter than an Spell Card she had. "YOU CAN?! ", she shouted in excitement, resulting in Youmu being gifted with another soft, warm hug, once again getting a face full of bulbous breast flesh, this time with full nipple. Her face as red as a ripe radish, Youmu pleaded to be let go, "Yuyuko-sama...please...no more hugs...ehehe..." This embrace lasting longer than the last, Yuyuko finally releases her retainer. 'Thank you...again, Yuyuko-sama.", Youmu said catching her break once more. "Oh, you are very welcome, my sweet Youmu!"

Yuyuko's face was still beaming, but her happiness was soon replaced with curiosity, staring once more at the fateful Chocolate Cake. Turning back to Youmu, she ask, "Youmu?" "Yes?" "I have only now noticed...before you returned, I had managed to slice into the chocolate cake. It's a very deep cut, actually..." Joining her Lady at the plate, Youmu bend her head down to get a closer look. "Ooooh...yes, that is a deep cut, I can't give it to Reisen like this..." "Oops..." "It's fine, Yuyuko-sama. Like I said, I can easily make another one. For now...I'll let you eat this one, just like you wanted to." "REALLY?! Oh thank y-oh wait..." "Huh? W-what is it?" Youmu was slightly taken aback by the fact that her Lady was hesitating to eat something...that only happened when something was seriously wrong. "Weeeell, after all the trouble I have caused with this cake, I'd feel horrible if I only ate it by myself...Let's share it, Youmu!"

"Yuyuko-sama?!" Her Lady...sharing food?! Something was most definitely wrong! "Are you sure?" "I am positive! Besides, you'll never impress your little crush with that skinny frame, so you need some cake in you! So come, let's eat it together!"

Youmu didn't know what to say...her lady had a point, she had always been very small, in her height and her...assets. But she also knew that her Lady would not be satisfied with just 1 cake. She knew that if she joined her in this meal, she would be dragged along and forced to eat with Yuyuko for the rest of the ensuing binge across the land she takes every month. She hadn't taken one this month and she was overdue...What was Youmu going to say to Yuyuko's offer?
121231.title: Cake Drama

13.content:
The door creaked open, a sliver of light permeating the darkness. A silver haired young woman with braided hair and a blue maid's outfit set down a large plate of flan on the floor, with a spoon sitting atop it. She, Sakuya, looked up and ahead at a chubby young woman who looked about her age as she slowly walked forward, smiling. Flandre, having spent a majority of her life in the Scarlet Manor basement, didn't get much chance for exercise. She saw visitors once in a while, but her sister Remilia didn't allow her to play with them much for fear she would "break" them. As such, Flandre had started to put on weight recently, growing rather chubby. A small, bulging potbelly was visible under her crimson dress as well as thick chubby legs and thighs with a round bottom that seemed to jiggle a bit whenever she ran. She also seemed to have sizable, full looking and round breasts, likely a result of the fat accumulating there.

Regardless, Flandre paid little mind to such a thing. Her innocent mind was, if only for the moment, joyous in looking forward to more flan for the day. Sakuya had requested Remilia limit Flandre's flan intake per day, but Flandre's begging expression as she overheard this was too much for Remilia to bear. She dearly loved her sister and felt some guilt in keeping her locked away to prevent her from causing too much damage, perhaps even to herself, so it was hard for her to be too tough on her dear, sweet sister especially with how genuinely kind she was. This was, in a way, even worse considering this could be attributed to Flandre's childish personality, due to lack of mental development from being locked away.

Flandre hummed to herself as she cooed, eating more and more flan off her plate with an innocent smile on her face.

Sakuya smiled in a mix of happiness for seeing Flandre enjoying herself and pity for being born to such a fate.

Flandre noticed a look in Sakuya's eyes, tilting her head in curiosity and looking staring at her.

"Something wrong, Sakuya-san?" Flandre asked curiously, her eyes reflecting her childish innocence in her persona and tone.

"No, nothing. Just thinking." Sakyua said calmly as she shook her head with a smile. "Is there anything else you need, Imouto-sama?"

"Mmm...maybe some milk if we have some. Oh! And could you see if Patchy-san has books I could borrow, like that one from last week?"

Sakuya smiled and nodded, holding her hands and arms in front of herself in a courteous manner.

"Very well, I'll bring what you asked for later." She said calmly, before turning to leave. However, she was so preoccupied in her thoughts that Sakuya had not closed the door all the way. Flandre enjoyed the rest of her flan, singing aloud to herself about how yummy it was, when she saw the door wasn't locked and fully closed. She paused, thinking once more. She could go out of her room, see what everyone else is doing. True, she was aloud outside to walk freely in the Scalet Manor often, but the basement served as her main room for the time. She thought of leaving the room, maybe see her sister Remilia. ...Or maybe see if she could get her hands on some more flan!

In one of the forests of Gensokyo lived a young youkai of darkness named Rumia. The short blonde-haired, red-eyed youkai had a somewhat petite figure similar to that of a 10-year-old girl, and she wore a black vest and skirt snd a white blouse with a red tie around her neck. She also wore a red amulet in her hair like a ribbon, and she couldn't remove said amulet as it was sealing a greater power from her, according to the rumors from some people. As a youkai of darkness, Rumia has a perpetual sphere of darkness surrounding her body, and although Rumia can control and manipulate the darkness around her, said veil of darkness causes her to fly around aimlessly and bump into obstacles due tithe darkness obstructing her vision.

Rumia lives a simple life of a youkai, preying on humans to kill and devour. Although humans native to Gensokyo are off limits to be eaten by youkai, humans from the Outside World who wandered or were "gapped" into Gensokyo are fair game. Rumia was a voracious youkai, and there is nothing tastier to Rumia than the flesh of a human. Outsider humans were especially tasty to Rumia, and Rumia could tell whether an Outsider human was nearby through their scent. Lately, more Outsider humans have appeared in the forests of Gensokyo, and very few were able to escape being eaten by youkai. Very peculiar was that some of the Outsiders were tied up and wearing nothing but a fundoshi and a sack with the kanji symbol for 'sin' over their heads. Probably they were criminals and their punishment was to be hunted by youkai? At least Rumia found those types of Outsiders, dubbed 'Sinsacks', much easier to hunt down; Rumia was getting lazier with her hunting and found it generally a pain to do, especially when chasing humans had gotten her running into more trees than humans. Rumia's lifestyle of hunting and eating humans was catching up to her, though, as Rumia was developing a slight pudge on her body.

When Rumia is not hunting humans, she is seen hanging out with her fellow youkai friends. They include Cirno, the ice fairy who lives at the nearby Misty Lake; Mystia Lorelei, the night sparrow youkai who can sing and owns a grilled lamprey stand; and Wriggle Nightbug, the firefly youkai who can control bugs. Rumia were great friends with them, but for some reason she couldn't help but think about having her friends inside her, whatever that means.

One day, Rumia was flying in her forest searching for humans to prey on. Suddenly, Rumia:
